text: [Music]
Prince darling once upon a time a king
was out hunting when a little white
rabbit which his dogs were chasing
sprang into his arms for shelter hey
little fella don't worry no one's going
to hurt you he took it home to his
palace and ordered his servants to take
good care of it I am the truth fairy and
it was I who came to your arms as a
rabbit for shelter to test if you were
merciful and kind indeed you are asking
me for anything you want and I promise
that I will give it to you
the king was pleased madam when the time
comes if you will make my newborn son
the best of princes I shall be grateful
to you I want him to be a good kind and
a merciful King O king I promised to
watch over your son and if the need ever
arises push him so that he may correct
himself and become a good King as you
are the king was quite satisfied with
his promise put this ring on your son's
finger and I'll always be there to watch
over and guide him the baby prince was
so adorable that no one could help lever
him hence he was named Prince darlings
over the years Prince darling grew up to
become a handsome lad one day when he
was sitting beside his father's statue
remembering him his foster brother
Charles walked in what are you doing
here Prince darling don't you know we
are to go out hunting I remember brother
it's just that sometimes I miss father
so much
Prince darling Charles and his cousin
run set out to the forest to hunt while
riding Prince darling caught sight of a
girl he slowed down while his brothers
rode away he turned his horse towards
the direction of the girl and trotted
towards her the young girl was so very
pretty
that the prince almost immediately fell
in love with her he made up his mind at
once that he would marry her her name
was Celia and she was as good as she was
beautiful I've never seen anyone as
beautiful as you I'm going to marry you
and I think you will only be too happy
to become a great Queen seeing the
arrogance of the Prince
Celia fearless Lee said saya I am only a
shepherdess and a pole go but
nevertheless I will not marry you do you
dislike me no sire you are a very
handsome man and a prince too but it is
of no good to me for I do not wish to
spend my life with an arrogant man the
prince was very angry at this speech at
that moment his soldiers arrived looking
for him
he immediately commanded them to make
Celia a prisoner and carry her off to
his palace at that moment the ring
pricked him ah he tried to remove it
from his finger but failed at doing son
later that day when Charles saw him so
downcast he asked what was the matter
and when he explained that he could not
bear see Leah's bad opinion of him and
was resolved to be a better man in order
to please her his evil brother said to
him you are very kind to trouble
yourself about this little girl if I
were you I would soon make her obey me
remember that you are a king and that it
would be laughable to see you trying to
please a shepherdess who ought to be
only too glad to be your wife keep her
in prison
punish her but would it not be a shame
if I had an innocent girl punished
pristy leah has done nothing to deserve
punishment if people will not do as you
tell them they ought to suffer for it
and remember she's not innocent she made
a mockery of your love for her she
laughed at your love last in saying this
he was able to touch a weak point in his
brother's character or the prince in
quite a furious rage rushed off to find
her when he reached the room in which
celia had been locked up he was greatly
surprised to find that she was not in it
his anger was terrible and he vowed
vengeance against whoever had helped her
to escape celia at that moment the ring
pricked him again and the prince cried
out loud aha
how do I get this ring off my finger can
we talk about your ring some other time
though we have a great matter at hand
that needs your attention Charles and
Ron told the prince that it was Solman
his old tutor who would help Celia to
escape they even bribed a guard to say
this for minam
self had told them about it the prince
in great anger sent Charles with a
number of soldiers to bring Solman
before him in Chains like a criminal
after giving this order he went to his
own room but he had scarcely got into it
when there was a clock of Thunder which
made the ground shake and the truth
Barry appeared suddenly before him I
promised your father to watch over you
and if you were ever to become evil
punish you your father was a good man
but you have gone your own evil way it
is time that I should fulfill my promise
and begins your punishment I condemn you
to resemble the animals whose ways you
have imitated you have made yourself
like the lion by your anger and like the
loo by your greediness like us to make
you have ungratefully turned upon one
who was a second father to you you're
sure lessness has made you'd like a fool
therefore in your new form take the
appearance of animals as soon as the
truth Barry finished Prince darling saw
to his horror that her words were
fulfilled
he had a lion's head of bull's horns a
wolf's feet and a snake's body at the
same instant he found himself in a great
forest beside a clear lake in which he
could see plainly the horrible creature
he had become and a voice said to him
look carefully at the state to which
your wickedness has brought you Prince
darling recognized the voice of the
fairy truth and began to think that the
best thing he could do would be to get
as far away from the lake as he could so
that he would not be continually
reminded of his terrible ugliness
so he ran toward the wood when he
stopped under a tree a huge image came
down and trapped him and the hunters who
were hiding behind the tree came out the
hunters carried a cage and they
approached the town he saw that some
great rejoicing was being held and when
the hunters asked what had happened they
were told the bad prince is dead and his
foster brother and cousin who tried to
seize the kingdom and divide it between
them were fled out of the kingdom by the
people
the man narrated that the people had
offered the crown to Solman whom the
Prince had left in prison he is the good
and just man and we shall once more
enjoy peace and prosperity and that is
why we are rejoicing Prince darling Lord
but it was still worse for him when he
reached the great square before his own
palace
II saw Suleiman seated upon a
magnificent throne and all the people
crowded around wishing him a long life
that he might undo all the mischief done
by his predecessor I have accepted the
crown you have offered me but only that
I may keep it for Prince darling who is
not dead as you suppose the fairy has
assured me that there is still hope that
you may someday see him again
good and virtuous alas he was led away
by flatterers I knew his heart and am
certain that if it had not been for the
bad influence of those who surrounded
him he would have been a good King and a
father to his people I would die gladly
if that could bring back our prince to
reign justly and worthily what's more
these words went to Prince darlings
heart he realized the true affection and
faithfulness of his old tutor and for
the first time reproached himself for
all his evil deeds
soon the hunters who had caught him took
him to a great menagerie where he was
kept up among all the other wild beasts
one day when this keeper was asleep
a tiger broke exchange and blew at him
to Prince darling who saw what was going
on wish that he were free I would want
to save my captors life he had hardly
which this in his iron cage blew open
and he rushed to the side of the keeper
and scared the tiger away then came and
crouched at the feet of the man it had
saved overcome with gratitude the keeper
stooped to caress the strange creature
which had done him such a great service
but suddenly a voice said in his ear a
good action should never go unrewarded
at the same instant the monster
disappeared and the keeper saw at his
feet only a pretty little dog Prince
darling delighted by the cheese that
frisked about the keeper showing his joy
in every way he could and the man taking
him up in his arms carried him to the
king to whom he told the whole story I
would like to have this wonderful little
dog one day when he was given a little
low for breakfast he thought he would
like to eat it out in the garden so he
took it up in his mouth and trotted out
of the palace soon he was in a palace
where stood a great house that seemed to
be built of gold and precious stones
numbers of people splendidly dressed for
going into it and sounds of music and
dancing and feasting could be heard from
the windows but what seemed very strange
was that those people who came out of
the house more pale and thin and their
clothes were torn and hanging in rags
about them Prince darling went up to a
young girl who was trying to eat a few
blades of grass she was so hungry
touched with compassion he said to
himself I am very hungry but I shall not
die of starvation before I get my dinner
if I give my breakfast to this poor
creature
perhaps I may save her life so he laid
his piece of bread in the girl's hand
and saw her eat it up
eagerly suddenly there was a great
outcry turning around he saw Celia who
was being carried against her will into
the great house Paul asked I am furious
with the people who are carrying Celia
off but isn't that exactly what I did
myself and if I had not been prevented
did I not intend to be still more cruel
to her just then he was interrupted by a
noise above his head someone was opening
a window it was an old lady who came
forward and threw out a plate of most
delicious-looking food then the window
was shut again
Prince darling ran forward to eat the
food but the young girl gave a cry of
Terror and took him up in her arms
saying don't touch it my poor little dog
that house is the palace of pleasure and
everything that comes out if it is
poisoned at that moment a voice said you
see a good action always brings its
reward the Prince found himself changed
into a beautiful white dove rising into
the air
he flew towards the house but it
suddenly disappeared from existence the
prince in despair determined to search
through the world till he found her he
flew on and on for several days till he
came to a great desert where he saw a
cavern and to his delight there sat
Celia sharing the simple breakfast of an
old hermit there she is
overjoyed to have found her prince
darling perched upon her shoulder trying
to express by his caresses how glad he
was to see her again and Celia surprised
and delighted by the tameness of this
pretty white dove stroked it softly I
accept the gift that you make me of
yourself Oh white does and I will love
you always take care of what you are
saying Julia are you prepared to keep
that promise
indeed I hope so my sweet shepherdess
you promise to love me
always tell me that you really mean what
you said or I shall have to ask the
fairy to give me back the form of the
Dove which pleased you so much you need
not be afraid that she will change her
mind
Celia has loved you ever since she first
saw you only she would not tell you
while you were so obstinate and arrogant
now you have repented and mean to be
good you deserve to be happy and so she
may love you as much as she likes Prince
darling bow down in front of the fairy
rise my child and I will transport you
to to the palace and Prince Charlie
shall have back again the crown he
forfeited by his bad behavior while she
was speaking they found themselves in
Salman's Hall and his delight was great
at seeing his dear master once more he
gave up the throne joyfully to the
prince and remained always the most
faithful of the his subjects Celia and
Prince darling reigned for many years
Prince darling governed his kingdom and
his people worthily the ring never
pricked him again and soon disappeared
because good deeds never go unrewarded
[Music]
